channel.title: Confused... Cache?
channel.description:
Okay. People keep saying "New cache this" & "New cache that"
What I would like to know, Plain and simple. What is the "Cache"
Is the "Cache" all the files that are in .file_store_32 that RuneScape downloads to your computer?
If so, can't "Anyone" get the "New Cache" by logging onto RuneScape?
and how do you find out its "Version" 377 this 315 that, blablabla, It would be less confusing if people actually Explained things.

item.title: Confused... Cache?
item.dc:creator: @Finnagon Finnagon
item.description:
@Finnagon wrote:

So how did he get the “cache” in the first place, If it was done once, it can be done again yes?

Hook me up with the right tools and ill spend all day if i have to getting the new cache and whatever from the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused... Cache?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

And since you have to decompile the classes to even attempt to trace the points that things are getting loaded from, you cant even try to edit it with debugging information, because most modern compilers don’t decompile things correctly most of the time. So I’m making my own.

Ok but you know how much I HATE decompiling so I will send you the 317 open-sourced deob.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused... Cache?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

And since you have to decompile the classes to even attempt to trace the points that things are getting loaded from, you cant even try to edit it with debugging information, because most modern compilers don’t decompile things correctly most of the time. So I’m making my own.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused... Cache?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:3, topic:32337”]Yes. Quite simply, that is what the cache is.

The version numbers your talking about are most likely the client versions.

Yes, anyone can play RuneScape and it will automatically download the cache.
But since the client has been changing so much, the cache is no longer in a form that our
clients can use properly. Thats why many people are spending so much time trying to make one that is compatible with it.[/quote]

Almost correct. The numbers do represent the cache, but it’s the deobfuscator (deob) that makes the cache compatible with our servers. Then we add another 50 classes or so onto those to make the JFrame show up and use network Java to connect to the IP specified through the server’s socket.[br][size=1]Posted at: December 05, 2006, 05:27:30 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Itachi Uchiha, post:10, topic:32337”]and editing and adding onto a client isnt as easy as it sounds…[/quote]

Its not because a client is just a few class files making a window appear. Then it connects to the server through sockets. You need a deob that decodes the cache and paints it on the screeen as well as making it compatible with our server sources.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused... Cache?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

The “official cache from Jagex” is different than the ones we use. Its encrypted.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused... Cache?
item.dc:creator: @Finnagon Finnagon
item.description:
@Finnagon wrote:

So what’s stopping us making a client that is compatible with the official cache from Jagex?

So it’s constantly updated with the new items jagex release, and it’s up to us to put them into our servers or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Confused... Cache?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Yes. Quite simply, that is what the cache is.

The version numbers your talking about are most likely the client versions.

Yes, anyone can play RuneScape and it will automatically download the cache.
But since the client has been changing so much, the cache is no longer in a form that our
clients can use properly. Thats why many people are spending so much time trying to make one that is compatible with it.

Read full topic
